First Party Collection/Use: You register a phone number when you create a Signal account.
Phone numbers are used to provide our Services to you and other Signal users.
You may optionally add other information to your account, such as a profile name and profile picture.
Third Party Sharing/Collection: We work with third parties to provide some of our Services.
For example, our Third-Party Providers send a verification code to your phone number when you register for our Services.
User Access/Edit/Deletion: You can manage your personal information in Signal’s application Settings.
For example, you can update your profile information or choose to enable additional privacy features like a Registration Lock PIN.
Data Retention: Signal cannot decrypt or otherwise access the content of your messages or calls.
Signal queues end-to-end encrypted messages on its servers for delivery to devices that are temporarily offline.
Data Security: Signal utilizes state-of-the-art security and end-to-end encryption to provide private messaging and Internet calling services to users worldwide.
Your calls and messages are always encrypted, so they can never be shared or viewed by anyone but yourself and the intended recipients.
International/Specific Audiences: You must be at least 13 years old to use our Services.
Policy Change: We will update this privacy policy as needed so that it is current, accurate, and as clear as possible.
User Choice/Control: You can manage your personal information in Signal’s application Settings.
Privacy contact information: If you have questions about our Privacy Policy please contact us at privacy@signal.org.
Introductory/Generic: Signal is designed to never collect or store any sensitive information.
